intro: Phalocallis oreophila, commonly known as the mountain phalocallis, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
